Class EReaderTestClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • EReaderTestClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class EReaderTestClass
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    Author:
    korrehenry COURSE: CSC 335; Fall 2020 Assignment: Team 2 - E-Reader Project Description: This Test class primarily tests the Model & Controller of the MVC structure for this E-Reader Program. This test class ensures that the saving state of the following: font type, font size, book being viewed, book title, book author, number of books, & more. Testing Details: This Test Class ensures at least 90% statement coverage for both the Model Class (EReaderModel.java) & Controller class (EReaderController.java).

      Constructor and Description
      EReaderTestClass()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testAddBook()
      Test Model & Controller for keeping track of how many books have been added to the model.
      void testBookMarkedPage()
      Test Model & Controller for Booking marking pages, save state of book marked pages, keeping the same reference of Page object & more.
      void testBookRefs()
      Test Model & Controller for save state reference of keeping track of the same book.
      void testChangeBook()
      Test Model & Controller for proper functionality of change a book to a different book title.
      void testChangeFonts()
      Test Model & Controller for save state reference of keeping track of font type and font size.
      void testCurrentPage()
      Test Model & Controller for save state reference of keeping track of the same page/current page object that is being broadcasted.
      void testGetAuthor()
      Test Model & Controller for keeping track of the current Author of the current book being viewed by the user / being broadcasted.
      void testGetTitle()
      Test Model & Controller for keeping track of the current Title of the current book being viewed by the user / being broadcasted.

        public void testAddBook()
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Test Model & Controller for keeping track of how many books have been added to the model. Additionally enforces that both the model and the controller are keeping track of the same references to the same book that is currently being broadcasted/ viewed by the user.

        java.io.FileNotFoundException
